dt: {bc}of a mild type or character that does not threaten health or life

quotes.t: Rather than a {qword}benign{/qword} fairytale creature that delivers babies, the marabou stork is an ugly, viciously predatory African bird that preys on flamingos …
When she chose to smile on me, I always wanted to thank her. The action was so graceful and inclusively {qword}benign{/qword}.

aq.source: {it}I Know Why the Caged Bird Sings{/it}

quotes.t: … her pulled-back black hair had gone gray in strange distinct bands, but she seemed much as he remembered her, solid and energetic, with a certain {qword}benign{/qword} defiance.
… substituting such {qword}benign{/qword} power sources as the hybrid, the fuel cell, and the electric motor in place of … the internal-combustion engine.

et: Middle English {it}benigne{/it}, from Anglo-French, from Latin {it}benignus{/it}, from {it}bene{/it} + {it}gignere{/it} to beget {ma}{mat|kin|}{/ma}
shortdef: of a mild type or character that does not threaten health or life; especially : not becoming cancerous

dt: {bc}an attitude or policy of ignoring an often delicate or undesirable situation that one is held to be responsible for dealing with

shortdef: an attitude or policy of ignoring an often delicate or undesirable situation that one is held to be responsible for dealing with

dt: {bc}a condition marked by short, recurrent episodes of {d_link|vertigo|vertigo} and {d_link|nystagmus|nystagmus} brought about by a change in head position that is caused by the movement of small crystals of calcium carbonate in the inner ear that have become dislodged from the {d_link|utricle|utricle} and entered the {d_link|semicircular canals|semicircular canal}

dt.t: Doctors eventually told her she probably had {wi}benign paroxysmal positional vertigo{/wi}, an inner-ear disorder, and gave her head-movement exercises to treat it.

shortdef: a condition marked by short, recurrent episodes of vertigo and nystagmus brought about by a change in head position that is caused by the movement of small crystals of calcium carbonate in the inner ear that have become dislodged from the utricle and entered the semicircular canals —abbreviation BPPV, BPV

dt: {bc}enlargement of the prostate gland caused by a benign overgrowth of chiefly glandular tissue that occurs especially in men over 50 years old and that tends to obstruct urination by constricting the urethra

shortdef: enlargement of the prostate gland caused by a benign overgrowth of chiefly glandular tissue that occurs especially in men over 50 years old and that tends to obstruct urination by constricting the urethra —abbreviation BPH
